parametrized_description: There are two processes, Process A and Process B. Executing Process A once requires GoldRequiredProcessA units of gold and WireRequiredProcessA wires, and plates CoinsPlatedProcessA coins. Executing Process B once requires GoldRequiredProcessB units of gold and WireRequiredProcessB wires, and plates CoinsPlatedProcessB coins. A total of TotalGoldAvailable units of gold and TotalWiresAvailable wires are available. Determine the number of executions of Process A and Process B to maximize the total number of coins plated.

GoldRequiredProcessA.description: Amount of gold required to run Process A once

WireRequiredProcessA.description: Number of wires required to run Process A once

CoinsPlatedProcessA.description: Number of coins plated per execution of Process A

GoldRequiredProcessB.description: Amount of gold required to run Process B once

WireRequiredProcessB.description: Number of wires required to run Process B once

CoinsPlatedProcessB.description: Number of coins plated per execution of Process B

ExecuteProcessA.description: The number of times Process A is executed

ExecuteProcessB.description: The number of times Process B is executed

constraints.description: The total amount of gold required for executing Process A and Process B does not exceed TotalGoldAvailable units of gold.
The total number of wires required for executing Process A and Process B does not exceed TotalWiresAvailable wires.

objective.description: The total number of coins plated is the sum of CoinsPlatedProcessA multiplied by the number of executions of Process A and CoinsPlatedProcessB multiplied by the number of executions of Process B. The objective is to maximize the total number of coins plated.
